#Text=Alto Ribeira State Touristic Park
#Text=The Alto Ribeira State Touristic Park ( Parque Estadual Turístico do Alto Ribeiro - PETAR ) is a state park in São Paulo state , Brazil .
#Text=It is a prime destination for cave exploring , containing the Gruta da Casa da Pedra cave , with the largest cave mouth in the world .
#Text=Understand
#Text=The park has one of the largest concentrations of caverns on the planet — more than 300 — in a region of untouched Atlantic forest covering mountains and ridges .
#Text=This natural heritage site is made up of paleontological , archeological , and historical sites , not to mention the extreme biodiversity and speleological richness to be found in the region .

#Text=The high precipitation index , coupled with its action on the limestone , is responsible for the formation of the caverns and their endless stalactites ( on the ceiling ) , stalagmites ( on the floor ) , columns ( from ceiling to floor ) , and curtains .
#Text=The caverns include both horizontal ones ( grottoes ) and vertical ones ( abysses ) .
#Text=Due to its area — almost 36,000 hectares — visitation is limited to areas concentrated around four different nuclei : Santana , Caboclos , Ouro Grosso and Casa da Pedra .

#Text=PETAR , in conjunction with the state parks of Jacutinga , Intervales , and Carlos Botelho , and the Xitué Ecological Station , forms a large , contiguous area of Atlantic Forest with more than 200,000 hectares and an immense variety of species .
#Text=The whole region has be designated a Biosphere Reserve by UNESCO .
#Text=History

#Text=Prior to the arrival of the Portuguese in 1500 , the Atlantic Rainforest surrounded most of the Brazilian coast , but it has now been mostly decimated with exception of a few pockets , which now compose the Atlantic Rainforest South-East Reserves , a UNESCO World Heritage Site .
#Text=The Ribeira Valley , between the states of São Paulo and Paraná , contains most of the remaining primary rainforest .
#Text=The Alto Ribeira State Touristic Park ( PETAR ) was created in 1958 .
#Text=Landscape
#Text=The park is spread across the Serra da Boa Vista range , part of the Serra de Paranapiacaba .
#Text=Besides the exuberant rainforest covering this mountainous terrain , the most distinguishing traits of PETAR are its limestone caves - totaling 300 .
#Text=Of these , only 12 are open to the public .
#Text=The park also contains 20 waterfalls and the towns of Iporanga and Apiaí .
#Text=Flora and fauna
#Text=The landscape is covered with virgin Atlantic Forest .
#Text=Araucária trees , Brazilwood trees , palm trees , orchids , and bromeliads are common .
#Text=There are also many ficus trees , whose roots can reach many meters into the earth .
#Text=The larger trees can reach 40 meters in height .

#Text=The larger mammals which live in this habitat include the Red Brocket ( a type of small deer ) , the Tayra ( a type of weasel ) , the Jaguar , the Otter , the Southern Muriqui ( a type of wooly spider monkey ) , the Robust Capuchin Monkey , and the Howler Monkey .
#Text=Birds include the Harpy Eagle , the Vinaceous-breasted Amazon ( a type of parrot ) , the Black-fronted Piping Guan , and the Dusky-legged Guan .
#Text=Get in
#Text=All visitor centres are only accessible by car .
#Text=Two visitor centers - Núcleo Santana and Ouro Grosso - are located at SP-165 , between Iporanga and Apiaí .
#Text=Núcleo Caboclos is at SP-250 , between Apiaí and Guapiara .

#Text=For those coming from São Paulo , it is better to first take the BR-116 ( Régis Bittencourt ) , then take the SP-193 at Jacupiranga towards Eldorado , and finally , the SP-165 towards Iporanga and Apiaí .
#Text=Those coming from Iguape or Ilha Comprida can reach Jacupiranga through the SP-222 , passing through Paiquera-Açu .
#Text=For those who do n't have their own means of transport , an alternative is to hire a tour agency , such as :
#Text=Ipotur , Rua Diogo Ribeiro de Oliveira 67 , Alto do Coqueiro - Iporanga , ☏ +551198515737 , +55 13 96076579 .
#Text=Núcleo Terra , Rua João Evilásio Nunes , 160 , Alto do Coqueiro - Iporanga , ☏ +5515 3556-1125 , +55 11 3628-2758 .
#Text=Fees and permits
#Text=Most visits to the PETAR require a licensed guide , requiring you to contact the park 's main office :
#Text=PETAR Public Use Team ( Equipe Uso Público PETAR ) , Av. Isidoro Alpheu Santiago , 364 - Fepasa - Apiaí , ☏ +5515 3552-1875 , ✉ petar@fflorestal.sp.gov.br .
#Text=Tours generally cost R$ 9 ; cars have an admission fee of R$ 6 , and motorbikes , of R$ 4 .
#Text=Caves
#Text=Santana Cave , Rodovia SP-165 , km 159 ( Núcleo Santana ) , ☏ +5515 3552-1875 .
#Text=The most visited cave in the park and arguably the most beautiful .
#Text=It is 7-km-long , but only the first 800 meters are open to the public .
#Text=Cave exploration takes about 2 hours and has low difficulty .
#Text=R$ 9 .
#Text=Morro Preto Cave , Rodovia SP-165 , km 159 ( Núcleo Santana ) , ☏ +5515 3552-1875 .
#Text=Cave famous for its cave mouth , which is particularly beautiful when seen from inside and against the light .
#Text=Exploration has medium difficulty and takes about 1 hour .
#Text=R$ 9 .
#Text=Couto Cave , Rodovia SP-165 , km 159 ( Núcleo Santana ) , ☏ +5515 3552-1875 .
#Text=A nice cave to observe the exhuberant rainforest from inside .
#Text=Exploration takes 1 hour and has low difficulty .
#Text=R$ 9 .
#Text=Água Suja Cave , Rodovia SP-165 , km 159 ( Núcleo Santana ) , ☏ +5515 3552-1875 .
#Text=A large cave containing a river .
#Text=It has 1.8 km , with 800 meters open to the public .
#Text=Part of the internal trail is completely dark .
#Text=Medium difficulty , 40 minutes to reach the cave + 2 hours of exploration .
#Text=R$ 9 .
#Text=Casa de Pedra Cave , Núcleo Casa de Pedra , ☏ +5515 3552-1875 .
#Text=Casa de Pedra has the largest cave mouth in the world , which is 173 meters high .
#Text=The cave has 5.5 km of internal galleries , but unfortunately , its interior is not open to the public due to safety considerations .
#Text=The stunning visual of the cave mouth is worth a visit by itself , however , and can be reached through a 4-km trail with high difficulty .
